quoteFirst: If the clergy of Ajaccio, however, have no sense of humour, they apparently understand the meaning of hard work; for I was struck by a written notice, affixed to one of the confessionals, which stated that a certain Abbé Simconi, one of the cathedral staff, attends daily here from
quoteLast: , and from 1 to 6 p.m., for the purpose of hearing the confessions of his flock. After this, no one can say that the Corsican clerics are idle.
title: A Lady's Tour in Corsica, Vol. 1 (of 2)
author: Forde, Gertrude

quoteFirst: On the first day of the New Year, these rumours took more definite shape, and on that day Her Majesty’s audience with the Grand Council lasted from
quoteTime: six to eleven in the morning
quoteLast: ; but even then no decision had been come to in regard to complying with the demand for Chao’s execution. Throughout the neighbourhood of the Drum Tower the streets were packed with a huge crowd, who threatened that they would certainly rescue Chao if he were taken out for execution.
title: China under the Empress Dowager
author: Bland, J. O. P. (John Otway Percy), 1863-1945; Backhouse, E. (Edmund), Sir, 1873-1944
